title: So much fun!
text: We went bowling as a staff "retreat" and had so much fun. The staff at the lanes were extremely helpful in getting us set up. And then delivered all our lunches as well! Really great experience.

title: Wow! Especially with a tanker going through
text: This is a really interesting site and well worth the side trip. Our teen really enjoyed thinking of the engineering to tackle this. There is bungie jumping available which may work for some but not our thing. We loved watching a tanker pulled by a tug going through with the crew below yelling Happy New Year and all of us on bridge doing the same. Plus the scenic highway to Nafplio starts right here so very easy for driving.

title: Fascinating and beautiful
text: Amazing to walk through Lion's Gate and to think about the intersection of pre-civilization and civilization. Good museum. As usual ( as we found in Greece) when touring the site itself the interp signs do not tell the story or the connected myths. More focused on mechanics and architecture. But museum did a good job with this. With teens, definately worth reading the myths enroute before doing a site visit.

title: Perfect Hotel!
text: Such a nice hotel in a perfect location. You can walk everywhere. The views are fantastic. The rooms are clean, modern and comfortable. I highly recommend this boutique hotel on the waterfront. They will be closed for renovations soon until mid March 2020.

title: Nice Atmosphere
text: The food was good, the service really fast and the atmosphere very nice. Enjoyed dinner here. It was packed with Greek nationals which is a good sign. Staff were welcoming.

title: Meteora Great, Drive to Kalambaka not so much
text: Everyone said we had to see Meteora in Central Greece so we made the four hour trek from Delphi. After crossing beautiful Mt Parnassus area, we were funneled down into confusing toll superhighways. ( Make sure you have studied which way to go because if you go the wrong way, it may be 20 plus miles before you can exit!l). The area of Central Greece we traveled across was full of smoke and lots of highway construction. The sprawl around Trikala worried us. The hotel we had booked was on a highway with many neon lights. Where is this world class UNESCO site, we wondered? But, the journey was indeed worth it. The next day we visited three of the monasteries in the pouring rain and all were beautiful. Varlaam has a great museum. Worth the effort to get here! If possible, I recommend booking a home or hotel well up towards the rocks in Kalambaka as this part of the village is very nice

title: Great hike and attraction
text: We walked the 999 steps with our teen and our little guy ( about 8). Well worth it! The views are amazing and history of the castle really interesting. Fun to come down into lively city having earned our lunch!

title: So Much Fun!
text: What great atmosphere and energy this bar/eatery has. Foood was excellent as was the service. So much fun to see all the patrons having a good time. The decor is funky and special too.

title: Great tour with Magnificent Michael
text: Wow, this is a great tour. It was a highlight of our time in Athens. I recommend doing it the first day. Our guide Michael was A+++. He has a deep love of the history, great training and education on history, the ability to tell it in stories, and links past and present. His English is perfect and he seemed to know every language in our group. We travel a lot and he is one of the best guides we have had.

title: Architectual and Historical Wonder
text: The antiquities housed here are fantastic, and the building itself is worth visiting. We loved being able to walk through the excavated site below - which is apparently new for 2019. Watch for clever pickpocketers and scammers around the outside entrances and I imagine, some make it inside. One kid with an accordian and a cup of coins we supposedly kicked over, was a great actor but got chewed out by a Greek mama walking by

title: Tourist trap, low value
text: We were hungry after visit to Acropolis and this is first larger patio restaurant we came across on walk down north side. The person who seated us was extremely rude. When I asked him not to offer something to one of my children, he said " I am a man and I do what I want" and reached over me to offer it to my child. We should have left then. The food was passable but not worth the price. They allowed sellers into the eating area who accosted us to buy things. Further down the road there ate many, many places with great reviews. Avoid.

title: Buying tickets
text: In December, it is the discounted season for tickets which is great. There are two lines. One is for the machine which only take Visa and Mastercard ( but did not take our Visa for some reason); the other line goes to the booths where they take all forms of payment. This line is longer but moves quickly as many ticket sellers who know what they are doing. If from EU country, kids get a discount. Non-EU countries, kids over 5 pay same as adults. Although moderate crowds on the site, no a problem at all and easy to read all the interpretive signs.

title: Great little hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay on this lovely little hotel. It was so close to everything going on at the Christmas Markets, including just down the steps from the festive Upper Town. The breakfast ( included) was amazing. We had a suite which was perfect for our family of four. They also helped us with transfer to airport at great price. Highly recommended

title: Teen Ennjoyed It
text: You know how it is to travel with many teens.... tiring quickly of museums, ruins and history. Well, our teen reallly liked this 2-hour tour. The guide was young, interesting, funny. Great overview of Zagreb

title: Fantastic Christmas dinner
text: Zagreb has a paucity of good quality restaurants open on Christmas day. We wandered around for 45 minutes and either were told places were full ( big fancy hotels) or they were selling sweets and drinks only. We stumbled upon this fantastic place that had only been open for 10 days after being closed for decades it sounded like. The atmosphere was wonderful, excellent food, decent prices. Highly recommended.

title: Lovely place to sit or eat
text: We stumbled on this lovely place and had afternoon drinks after enjoying the fountain (quite impressive-all pottery and huge). Good gift store attached with high quality items.
place: La Casona de Valladolid by Xcaret

title: What a Treat!
text: We LOVED this tour with a capital L. The art is fantastic and the story of the home and collection is fascinating. The owners, who have generously opened their home to tours, are very welcoming. Inspirational. Be on time or you will miss the one tour they have daily.

title: Wonderful courtyard and dining
text: This hotel is centrally located on the square, close to shopping and restaurants. It has a wonderful "onda" in the courtyard, bar and dining area. The rooms are fine (small which is typical here) with good bathrooms. A wonderful rooftop patio. Food is very good with a huge breakfast included. I would stay here again.

title: A great surprise!
text: Wow- who expected such a great and exotic food selection. Wonderful food and atmosphere. We all loved it

title: Loved Vinales
text: What a beautiful, great place. Yes there are tourists. Yes every house in town is an Air BB. But it is so lovely with nice resturants and so much to do. We rode horses, went on a cave tour, walked through some gorgeous valleys and met wonderful people. This was our teenagers favorite place in Cuba. Safe enough that he could go all over town at any time on his own.

title: A treasure
text: For a town this size, we are so fortunate to have the Lincoln. Exceptional and wide array of movies, plays and events. Just take in a movie to sit in the theater's historic ambiance. The popcorn is good too! The Lincoln is a local treasure.

title: Not What It Used To Be
text: Been coming here for years. Today they forgot about us. After quite a time and wait, I asked if we could order. Have noticed a potent, bad smell in the restaurant last few times I have been here. Almost a sewage smell

title: They must think we all need the exercise
text: This wins my award for "most thoughtless" transportation center in North America. Toronto's Union Station has never been easy to navigate through but with construction on-going it is awful. No signs, stairs everywhere, maybe they are elevators- no one seemed to know - certainly not marked. No ramps for rolling suitcases. Sweat was dripping off me in buckets by the time I lugged my bag from the subway, up numerous stairs, around the station due to no signs, more stairs. Just awful.Pack light and plan your trip before hand as the thousands of commuters can't help answer questions

title: Great Atmosphere
text: This is a great place with good food but the last few times we have gone there it needed a bit of freshing up. Hard to keep it up on a daily basis I imagine as it sees so much business. Great atmosphere

title: Best Hamburger in the Valley
text: We love this place. The food is excellent for a tavern setting-absolutely love their burgers. And the setting is so peaceful. In the summer you can sit out back on their lawn and just enjoy the surrounding farmland views and views of Mt Baker. They don't pump the music at ear shattering volumes and respect the neighborhood. Just a fun place and excellent bar food. The wait staff and bartenders could not be nicer

title: Excellent food, excellent atmosphere
text: I had the vegetarian platter for one. It was excellent - spiced well with fresh vegetables and lots of various Ethiopian dishes. Some of the best Ethiopian food I have had in the US or in Ethiopia. My only suggestion would be that the restaurant either regularly circulates with more injera for those of us who use it all ... or put a fork at each place setting. Otherwise one can end up looking at lots of food on your with no way to eat it properly. The atmosphere was excellent and very pleasant.

title: Nice, high quality but pricey, items
text: Lovely items and well made but out of our price range. However it was nice to see high quality local items and some good art. Gave us some good ideas about what to look for in local items

title: world class
text: Amazing and worth the effort to visit. Only do 1-2 churches in a day however as the approaches (which are beautiful) can be long with hot afternoons

title: All Senses Activated
text: Be prepared for sensory overload, but this is life in motion and real. Amazing place. There are guides you can hire to get you around the market and this may be a good idea. We didn't buy anything because we were overwhelmed- walking through was enough. Every other person had something on their head. One fellow we passed was carrying 4 rolls of barbed wire...on his head! The people were overall, very friendly. The recycling areas are truly something to see

title: Perfect for airport and day of rest
text: Like many others, we chose this hotel as we had an early morning flight out of Rome. The hotel was perfect for exploring Fiumicino. Their breakfast (included) is excellent, rooms are clean and spacious, huge beds, shuttle is on-time. Best of all the waterfront in front of the hotel is full of great places to eat seafood. We enjoyed watching the fishing boats and quiet pace of Fiumicino. On the advice of a local we purchased an all-day metrebus pass (8 euro) and took trains, buses, subways to Rome and back quite easily. There are buses that go to the train station (one stop before the airport terminal), It takes an hour or less to get to central Rome on public transport this way. However, in retrospect we would have spent the whole day in Fiumicino as quite a nice place after a busy few days in cities.

title: Fabulous!
text: We were looking for a good place for seafood and atmosphere and could not have done better than the Ristorante Portus. A wide range of seafood and other dishes, good wines, good service and a charming atmosphere. Excellent appetizers.

title: Best Value in Addis
text: We have taken 5 trips to Ethiopia so have tried many hotels in Addis, The Jupiter Cazanchis is by far the best value. Nice rooms (and they let our kids stay with us -many Addis hotels add extra for this but the Jupiter did not which is why we first selected them), extremely helpful staff, central, free airport shuttle, included breakfast is excellent, great bar and lobby, and they serve both national and western food. Many Ethiopians also use this hotel which is nice. We got the holiday discount which made the value exceptional. We were going to try other hotels but stayed here on all our nights in Addis as we liked it so much

title: Good overview of Ethiopia, excellent music museum
text: Some of the videos and films in the museum were excellent. The most extensive collection of traditional musical instruments I have seen, Excellent orientation to cultures of Ethiopia. Art museum is mostly religious works but of good quality. This is not the national museum (Lucy etc)-in some ways, I preferred this one as more about the people and their lives

title: Lovely!
text: The gardens and rooms are wonderful. The meals, just "ok". However luckily the Cultural Center down the street serves some of the best food in this part of Ethiopia at great prices - so the combination is perfect,

title: AVOID!!
text: We had stayed here several years ago and it has gone downhill badly. The location is great (above the stella field) but the rooms are in horrible condition. Mold in bathrooms, etc. Food was also pretty bad. They tried to charge us $105 for a triple- the room is worth a fraction of this. Someone needs to buy this hotel and renovate it like they have done to other old government hotels. Will not stay here again until I hear it has been renovated

title: Relaxing, great birding
text: What a wonderful place! We had two days of relaxing and bird watching here. Took the bus from Gondar which was 3.5 hrs long (road under construction) but in the end well worth it. The lodges are so sweet, food is wonderful, other guests are great company and the birding is outstanding. Guests are treated as new found family. We loved it here and would stay longer next time.

title: Great mid-range hotel with lovely patio on lake
text: For the price ($50/night) this place can't be beat. The gardens and patio are lovely with great birding opportunities. Boats arrive right to the hotel for lake and church tours. The path to town is good and pleasant to walk. Fine breakfast included. Tuk-tuks into town are cheap

title: Excellent restaurant at Cultural Center
text: The cultural part of the center was closed when we visited but the restaurant was open and it is excellent! The salads are huge and fresh, traditional dishes are great and cheap. Best place eat locally

title: Good location
text: The Beehive has a central location just a few minutes walk from Termini Station. Seemed a little overpriced as really an enhanced hostel. Breakfast not included and no airport shuttle. But clean rooms and staff were friendly and knowlegeable. A little further out of the downtown we got a very nice hotel room with breakfast for just a small amount more, so the price must be all about location. Lots of restaurants and small hotels in area. Heard a fight outside our window and street cleaner was early and loud. But all in all it was quite fine for a night or two. Staff speak English well and gave very good advice on what to see and how to do it

title: Nice atmosphere, good food
text: There are many Mexican Restaurants in the vicinity but this is the one I select when I have time to enjoy the food and the place. It is always full including with many Latinos - a good sign! The food is plentiful. Good parking as well.

title: Interesting stop and history
text: We had visitors who were interested in aviation and this was a great place to take them. Extremely hands on viewing. It is also great to see the planes flying around in the skies - they work! They are not just museum pieces

title: Great Atmopshere
text: Simply put - good atmosphere and food. It is quiet, pleasant and the food is very good. Once the new walkway along the Skagit River is complete (soon), the location will be ideal. A good place for business, family, couples. There is a private dining room that holds at least 12 comfortably.

title: New Ownership Makes This A Spa Worth a Visit
text: We have been going to Semiahmoo for years- under many different owners. The location is wonderful as it sits right on the water with excellent views of the Strait of Jaun de Fuca. In fact, it is often a delight to visit during winter storms. The outdoor heated pool is a huge plus as is the beach walking and birding. The prices have gone up but the new owners do it right. The seafood is some of the best I have seen/eaten in this part of the Northwest. Good portions, excellent presentation and super service. The hotel staff are attentive. The rooms are a bit small given the price but the beds are comfortable and the rooma have everything one needs. The lobby and fireplaces of the hotel make one feel cozy no matter the weather. The manager of Semiahmoo is obviously doing things right. This is by far the best management yet.

title: Best Thai Ever and Cute Place!!
text: Love this hole in the wall restaurant. The food is exceptional. They started with very generous portions but recently their soup bowls have shrunk a bit (for same price) - which is the only real disappointment, Otherwise, can't speak highly enough about their wide range of delicious dishes that you sit and watch being made and generous portions for all other dishes. If you only have one person to talk to ok for a business meal but otherwise its just a great counter lunch spot. Also do pick up.

title: Exceptional for Whole Family
text: This little jewel tucked away on Bayview-Edison Road in the Skagit is a must-see for a family. The center is beautifully managed, with interesting displays. The new aquarium is delightful. The real-time images of the nesting herons provided by Skagit Land Trust and the Interpretive Center are captivating. Usually I see these unusual birds hanging out in ditches and here they are caring for chicks in their nests. A walk down the twisty staircase to the beach is also a must. The views of Padilla Bay and the San Juan Islands alone are worth the trip. Then hop in your car and drive several minutes down the road to the foody town of Edison for a perfect day

title: Best Cinnamon Roles in the World
text: ....and the soups and sandwiches are pretty special too! Plus the nicest people make and serve the food. A great, low key dining experience looking at the Chuckanut Mountains and surrounding farmland. Great stop if on a bike or driving. Hard to walk to now since they moved onto Chuckanut Drive

title: Views to Die For
text: I love sipping a glass of wine in this restaurant looking at Puget Sound. There are bay windows that allow you to soak in the landscape, cloud formations, islands, trains, flocks of birds. I am not usually a meat eater but their steak and mashed potatoes are excellent - true comfort food. The service is exceptional. They treat people like they care.

title: Lonely but Lovely
text: We have a standing joke in our family that we cannot figure out how this place makes money as there is never anyone there. Plus they are the opposite of aggressive salespeople. The mellow vibe and "whatever" feeling is probably appropriate given they recently out up a green cross. Maybe they will finally get some business! The gardens are lovely

title: The Pies are the Ticket
text: The sweet couple who run this place make the best pies as long as you are not a sugar fiend. For me - perfect. This is the apple pie of old but may not be what the kids are expecting.

title: Not customer friendly for eating!
text: This used to be a nice normal, somewhat funky, store. It has had a complete re-model and looks very trendy now with higher end grocery products for sale. There is a restaurant and counter. However it is impossible to figure out what they sell to eat. There are very few things in their counter display. We asked "Do you have a menu?" - "No" (no explanation ). There is a chalk board with coffee but nothing else. Our son came back to us and said "They said I could have a grilled cheese sandwich.". So o.k. - that is a possibility. (It was not edible by the way- even the person who made it said she had overcooked it and yet she still handed it to a 10 year old and asked him to pay for it!). We saw someone eating soup or chili at the counter but by this time had given up. Not a good experience and we would not recommend it for eating. Which is too bad as it has a nice location but they really don't seem to care about the dining/lunch end of their operation.

title: Stick with the Great Simien Trip
text:
Tesfahun arranged an excellent 4-day Simien Mountain Trip for my family of four (2 adults and 2 children). The guide he selected for us, Getinet, was exceptional. Not only is his English flawless, his deep knowledge of the mountains and his experiences and community attitude were outstanding. We could not imagine a better guide and you would be very fortunate to have his services. Our cook, scout and child carrier (we arranged to have our youngest child carried) were also wonderful. The Simien Mountain themselves are exquisite. We loved the trip. The price was very reasonable and Tesfahun was attentive to our needs. WE advise that you bring your own sleeping bags and thermarests and some good warm clothes. Be advised that in Gondor many banks did not want our new $100 US bills (we eventually found one bank that did)

Because the Simien Mtn Trip worked out so well, we considered using the Simien Land Tours operator in Axum. Unfortunately this did not work out well and in the end we went with another company in Axum.

title: Great food, fine rooms
text: The AG Palace is central..but right now that means being in the middle of the subway mess. This makes it a little hard to access as the most direct route is blocked off. Once the subway is done however it will be very central. The rooms are small but fine and relatively quiet. The bathrooms are clean and water is hot and plentiful. The wi-fi is free and fast. The restaurant has excellent food - my son claimed it the best shirowat in all of Ethiopia

title: A bit over-priced but nice if you want quiet, spacious accomodation
text: Abbaba's Villa is an older home with wonderful atmosphere and traditional Ethiopian furniture etc. Lovely interior. The beds are extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are large and clean. The dinners are healthy although a bit bland. The breakfasts were fine but not hearty. They often ran out of things like milk for coffee or cereal. It is very quiet part of town so one can get a good night's sleep and the house and gardens are large so lots of room to stretch out. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. The price is similar to a downtown hotel which we found steep for where the Villa is located since you must take a taxi to get back and forth from town. There are no restaurants nearby (to speak of) so you either need to eat before you "taxi home" or eat their meals. It is located near the German, French and US Embassies. Be sure that you understand the rates. We had a confusion which caused us to pay more than we expected. Free airport transfer is only "from" the airport (not to). Overall, a very nice place however we felt it was over-priced for its location

title: Fine hotel
text: We had been to the Goha eight years ago and returned in November to find it good value. Although the rooms are on the small side they are comfortable and fine. The gardens and patio are exceptional. The food was very good with a wide variety of choices. The staff were overall friendly and helpful. With no extra charge the hotel stored our luggage while we did a 5-day hike in the Simien Mtns

title: Excellent but charged full meal rate for a toddler
text: The four sisters has excellent traditional food however when we got the bill we saw they had charged the full buffet rate for our 4 year old who ate 5 pieces of macaroni. We also had some small potentially tooth-breaking rocks and bits of bone in our lentils. Otherwise the food was very good and atmosphere exceptional.

title: Great Birding!
text: This hotel is just fine. The room are smallish but clean. The food is satisfactory. It is cheap and easy to take a tuk-tuk to town. What really sets the hotel apart is its great yard and bird life. We saw more birds here than on any other hotel grounds in Ethiopia. The guard knows the birds well and showed us many of their nesting areas. The exceptional birding opportunities - coffee cup in hand - makes for a very enjoyable stay plus the boats for tours of the churches can pick you up at the hotel. Just don't sit at the tables under the eves....!!

title: Peaceful, lovely but the "jet setting" interferes
text:
This is terrific value for the B & B rate in a stunning location. Take time to explore the grounds as they are lovely with many viewpoints of the valley and rock cliffs. Staff were a bit stand offish but also not hovering. Our room on the uphill side (room 9) initially seemed idyllic...until the helicopter arrived. It parked directly in front of our window and came and went repeatedly 3 out of the 4 days we were there which marred the "natural" "sustainable" motto of the lodge. One morning pre-dawn the pilot and aides loudly banged barrels and re-fueled so they could take off at dawn with their clients. Since we paid the same room rate as the jet-setters, I would hope in the future they get the rooms near their helicopter. (There seemed to be many disgruntled comments from other guests about the helicopter both at the lodge and dropping in at the otherwise peaceful rock churches - so the owner should carefully consider how to make this transport style fit the general tone of the place).

The dinners were good (but they eat late!) as were the breakfasts. The picnic lunches are way over-priced for what is included. We stopped in town on our way to the churches and bought essentially the same bread and bananas for a fraction of the price. We also ate frequently in town at an excellent restaurant- the Crealta. Other guests did not seem to go to town at all, however we enjoyed the easy walk and seeing the town and its people.

There is surprising scant information at the lodge about the nearby rock churches. There is not even a map that we could find and only one battered picture book that is not comprehensive. The staff were not helpful in this regard saying that what we visited was up to us - but since we didn't know anything it was hard to make decisions. So one has to have done their homework to know what churches to go and see, how accessible they are, the physical exertion needed and time to get there etc etc. One day we had a young and not very good local guide who said it was 'too hot" to see a second church (not!) and then proceeded to ask us for our shoes, our sunglasses, our headlamp etc. The next day we had an excellent guide.

We are surprised the lodge does not accept visa since there is no way to access an ATM nearby. This limits you to the birr you bring with you.

Overall a lovely place that we would return to

title: Stay at least an extra day to see this place
text: Most people fly in and out of Sandspit for their trip to Haida Gwaii. It is highly recommended that you spend several hours at the Heritage Centre outside of Skidegate (a short ferry ride across the inlet from Sandspit). If you do it before your trip you'll probably spend half a day there. If you do it afterwards you may spend longer. It puts so much of this lovely place and its culture and history into perspective.Some people recommend a visit on either end of the trip. As someone said - don't miss it.The cafe has some great seafood chowder! Wonderful collection of books and crafts for sale in gift shop.
place: Haida Heritage Centre at Kay Llnagaay

title: Fascinating & Beautiful
text: We stayed two nights at Sun Lakes/ Dry Falls State Park. Very much a kid friendly scene with lots to do and lots of action - like being in a neighborhood. Not a place for those looking for peace and quiet (they should instead go to Steamboat Rock State Park a bit further north). The Interpretive Center is very close to the Sun Lakes/Dry Falls campground and is very well done. The geology lesson is fascinating even for kids and the views are outstanding. You can stand there and imagine the water creating this place eons ago. Well worth a visit and even going out of your way to see it. Not to mention that the landscape from Dry Falls to Coulee Dam would be a National Park in most countries. There is a pretty good set of stairs to get up to the center but there is an elevator . May want to call to make sure it is working if an elevator is essential to your group.

title: Man Trying To Dominate Nature?
text: The dam is quite an impressive piece of work- even art. Certainly the evening laser light show over the cascading waters is art. It doesn't start until dark so can be a late evening with bugs - be prepared. The sound track for the laser show reminded me of the news tracks before movies during the war - a bit over the top on taming nature, making the desert flower etc. The exhibits themselves however do have a more balanced approach as they have an area where Native Americans tell their side of the story and what was lost. Environmentalists may have a hard time with the whole thing since exploring the down side of dams is minimal. Historians will find it interesting and most people will just enjoy it for a great example of human effort and what allows Eastern Washington to exist as the agricultural area it is today. It's quite remarkable how close they let you get to everything.

title: Great place to take Kids and Now Teens
text: The Ontario Science Centre has always been a good place to spend a day for kids 12 and under. Now, with the addition of the large hands-on Gaming Exhibit teens and young adults will also enjoy long days here. This part of the Centre was packed - in a good way with fun energy. You can easily get a spot on a game if you wait a few minutes as there are so many to select from. Good parking but also easy bus access

title: Spice of Life
text: This is one of the more vibrant city markets in North America. Situated in a lovely location within walking distance of the rest of the downtown, it has numerous wares and tasty items. Toronto has a diverse population and you see this simply in all the marvelous spices for sale here. It's not just the market that is interesting but its location, the neighborhood and the people at the market. There are great bookstores and art galleries nearby.

title: Central and bit Funky
text: I never thought I would use the word funky for a Hilton chain hotel, but it fits. The first view is impressive as is the valet service. But parking is then an extra charge. Internet in your room is also extra, but breakfast and the manager's happy hour are part of th package. It's all a strange arrangment but it works ok and comes out fairly reasonable. The rooms are good-sized suites. Many room face onto I-5 so they are noisy and the windows seem a bit old so don't keep all the noise out. It is very accesible to downtown.
place: Embassy Suites by Hilton Sacramento - Riverfront Promenade

title: Overpriced but Good Stay
text: A nice place on the edge of town with a great pool and hot tub. The rooms are private and quiet. The views are nice from the rooms. They even had a wine and cheese event for al of us.. You can walk to town or drive. The price is a bit steep but so are most places in Calistoga. A bit annoying that at $185/night they charge extra for a cot for a child and didn't provide enough blankets. The area is gorgeous!

title: Great Place, Great Price
text: We got this on an internet deal and it was fantastic value. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. The pool and hot tub were great for the kids and easy to access from our room. It has a nice feel with all rooms facing the courtyard. The breakfast included was huge. There is a Whole Foods Market across the street with everything you'd ever want to snack on. And it is close to great places for families like Cline Wineries and the Mission Museum.
place: Best Western Sonoma Valley Inn & Krug Event Center

title: Well Worth a Visit
text: Stumbled on this while at Cline Cellars and what a treat! Beautiful replicas of all the missions. Fascinating history. Free! The curator is very knowledgeable
place: California Missions Museum at Cline Cellars

title: Fun outing, pretty views
text: Watch out for the cliffs if you have kids. Otherwise a very nice place for a day trip from Seattle.

title: High price
text: Interesting museum but price tag for entry is way too steep. Stairs not appropriate for seniors

title: Lumpy chowder
text: I was so looking forward to this chowder and just didn't hit the spot. I got a to-go order and it was like eating tasyy wallpaper paste

title: Love this place
text: The food, the atmosphere, the ability to be in or out, up or down, the flowers and service - it's all great and the prices are fine

title: Good food-trendy
text: Who doesn't love the buzz of Anthony's? The views are fabulous but we have been turned away often here because it is so crowded. The food is very good. The views make the experience.

title: We all love Adrift
text: If you are traveling through Anacortes, be sure to stop at Adrift because they have the best meals in town and a great atmopshere to go with it!

title: Coffee and baked goods to go!
text: A great place to stop and get great coffee, even better cookies and baked goods and fantastic soup and sandwiches. Seems like everyone loves it as it is always full.

title: Pay Your Park Fees and Go!
text: For only a small enterance fee, you get to see one of the most beautiful places on the planet. The beaches are spectacular but what really sets this park apart are the old growth trees, the bridge itself, the CCC display and the ripping tide. It is rarely crowded- only on long weekends and holidays. Go mid week and you have it to yourself.

title: Food was So-So
text: Whenever I pass the Outback I think I want a steak. I finally convinced the family to give it a try and the meat was pretty poor. It was tasteless and felt mass produced. We won't go back

title: What a Great Secret Spot
text: On top of a hill in the very cute town of La Conner, sits the Skagit Historical Museum. It is full of interesting artifacts and displays and the views of the surrounding area are spectacular. The price is right

title: A Very Diverse Aquarium
text: I had been here years ago and although it was pretty, the displays were not much to write home about. Fast forward 5 years and wow- they have done some improvements. The aquarium is beautiful and diverse, the camera where you see the herons is great for kids and adults, the bird calls and the plantstare all interesting and then you can wander to Bayview State Park and the beach.
place: Padilla Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve

title: Fabulous Family Retreat
text: This is one of the best family retreats in the Pacific Northwest. We love the cozy cabins with real fireplaces, the long beach walks, the trips to the "mountain" up the great trail made by Skagit Land Trust, the kayak trips right off the beach, and most of all the the mornings and nights of quietness, stars, mist and fantastic views of the San Juans. The owners are kid and dog friendly and the price can't be beat. A one a kind place.

title: Fabulous
text: We loved staying here. The hosts could not have been friendlier. The quietness of the surroundings was special as we heard owls at night and other birds in the morning. The bed was the most comfortable we have experienced. The pool was perfect for our children and meeting other guests in this intimate setting was lovely. The breakfast was perfect with good coffee,fresh fruit and yogurt, hams, wonderful breads and jams and cereals our childfen loved.
place: Hotel La Fuente De La Higuera
